Michael Bryan

Biography

Season and Career Results WSU Record-Holder (after 2022)

Weight Throw - 21.17m/69-5.5 (2021)

Hammer Throw - 71.56m/234-9 (2022) First Team All-American

2022 Hammer Throw (5th: 71.56m/234'9") 2x Second Team All-American

2022 Weight Throw (14th; 20.96m/68'8.5")

2021 Hammer Throw (12th; 70.08m/229'11") NCAA Outdoor West Preliminaries

2022 Hammer Throw (3rd; 69.32m/227'5")

2021 Hammer Throw (9th; 66.30m/217'6") AAC Most Valuable Field Performer

2022 Indoor 3x All-Conference

Indoor

2022 Weight Throw (1st)

Outdoor

2022 Hammer Throw (1st)

2021 Hammer Throw (2nd) Academic Honors

6x AD Honor Roll - Spring 2022, Fall/Spring 2021, Fall/Spring 2019, Fall 2018

3x Academic All-Conference - 2022, 2020, 2019 2022: Indoor – Won five of seven meets in the weight throw, recording a school record 22.58m/74’1 at the AAC Indoor Championships to win the conference and qualify to the NCAA Indoor Championships…Earned Second Team All-America honors with a 14th-place finish at NCAAs. Outdoor – Placed in the top three in nine of 10 meets in the hammer throw, winning six titles…Completed the indoor/outdoor conference sweep with his AAC Outdoor Championship victory…Placed third at the NCAA West Prelims to move on to the championship meet in Eugene, Ore…Improved his school record to 71.56m/234’9” at the NCAA Outdoor Championships, earning First Team All-America honors with his fifth-place finish…Threw discus twice and placed seventh at conference to score two points for the team.

2021: Indoor – Had a historic indoor campaign in the weight throw … Won the weight throw four times … Set the school record at the Championship at The Peak with a throw of 21.17m/69-5.50 … Threw over 20 meters three times … Had top-five finishes at all seven meets he competed in. Outdoor – Had a historic campaign … Broke the school record on four separate occasions … Qualified for the NCAA Championships in the hammer throw … Took 12th to earn Second Team All-America honors at the NCAA Championships … Finished ninth at the West Regional to make it to Eugene, Oregon, in the hammer throw … Was the runner-up at the AAC Championships to earn all-conference honors … Set the school record in the hammer throw at the John McDonnell Invitational with a toss of 70.45m/231-2 … Won four hammer throw competitions … Won the Hayward Premiere to win the first event at Hayward Field after its renovation … Also threw the discus four times … Finished 13th in the discus at the AAC Championships.

2020: Indoor - Threw at eight meets for Wichita State … Took seventh in the weight throw at the AAC Championships with a season-best throw of 19.08m/62-7.25 … Also threw the shot put at the AAC Championships and took 12th … Opened his season with a win at the Shocker Prelude … Took second in the shot put and third in the weight throw at the Triangular … Also finished as the runner-up in the weight throw at the WSU Invitational and Arkansas Qualifier … Had top-five finishes at the Air Force Team Challenge in the shot put (fifth) and weight throw (second). Outdoor - 2020 season canceled.

2019: Indoor - Redshirted and competed unattached in two meets...Finished with two top-5 finishes, including a season best mark in the weight throw (15.99m/52-5.5) at the Shocker Prelude. Outdoor - Redshirted and competed unattached in four meets...Placed fourth in the Herm Wilson Invitational hammer throw with a mark of 56.84m/186-6...Won the Friends Spring Open hammer throw with a toss of 53.92m/176-11...Recorded a personal best 59.16m/194-1 finishing second in the K.T. Woodman Classic hammer throw.

Hutchinson CC: As a freshman he finished 10th in the hammer throw (49.09m/161-1) at the NJCAA DI Outdoor track and field championships…Finished fifth in the weight throw (15.57m/51-1) at the Region VI Indoor Championships his sophomore season…Placed seventh in the hammer throw (51.82m/170-0) and 11th in the discus (44.86m/147-2) at the 2018 NJCAA DI Outdoor Championships.

High School: Lettered four years in football, basketball, powerlifting and track and field…As a senior he finished sixth in discus at the state meet…Was awarded the Kansas State diploma award…Recruited by Kansas State and Hutchinson Community College.

Personal: Son of Sherrene Harbstreit and Andrew Bryan…Has two sisters, Maria and Christina, and one brother, Lawrence…Majoring in exercise science.
